author: NewsBreak Original
text:
10 hours ago Photo by southbendtribune SOUTH BEND, Ind. — Navigating the complexities of Medicare can be a daunting task , but St. Joseph County Public Library (SJCPL) is here to help. On November 14 , the library's Francis Branch will offer a free, informative session titled "Medicare 101" designed to demystify the Medicare process for seniors and their families.
Whether you're approaching the age of eligibility or need a refresher on the program's changes, this workshop is a valuable resource for anyone looking to better understand their Medicare options. The event will provide clear and accessible explanations about the various parts of Medicare, including Part A (Hospital Insurance), Part B (Medical Insurance), Part C (Medicare Advantage), and Part D (Prescription Drug Coverage) .
What to Expect at Medicare 101: Overview of Medicare Parts : Learn the basics of Medicare, from eligibility to coverage options. The session will explain how the program works and guide attendees through the different choices available for their healthcare needs. Enrollment Periods and Deadlines : One of the most common sources of confusion is knowing when to enroll and avoid penalties. This session will break down important dates and timelines, ensuring you don’t miss out on essential benefits. Cost and Coverage : Discover what’s covered under Medicare and what isn’t. The workshop will also offer insights into out-of-pocket costs, premiums, and other financial considerations. Q&A Session : Attendees will have the opportunity to ask questions and get personalized answers from experts, ensuring that each individual leaves with a clear understanding of their options. Why Attend? As millions of Americans approach retirement age, understanding Medicare becomes increasingly important. For many, this marks a pivotal time in their healthcare journey, and making informed decisions can have long-term benefits. Whether you're newly eligible or already navigating the system, "Medicare 101" provides a practical, no-pressure way to get the facts you need to make the best choices for your health and finances.
In partnership with local experts, the Francis Branch of the St. Joseph County Public Library is offering this session as part of its ongoing commitment to serve the community by providing free access to important educational resources. The library’s welcoming environment and knowledgeable staff make it a trusted space for learning and growth.
Event Details: Date : November 14, 2024 Time : 6:00 PM – 7:00 PM Location : St. Joseph County Public Library – Francis Branch, 5921 S. Ironwood Dr., South Bend, IN Admission : Free and open to the public Registration : Although the event is free, space is limited. Pre-registration is encouraged . Call the library at 574-282-4646 or visit the SJCPL website to secure your spot. A Resource for Our Community The St. Joseph County Public Library continues to be a hub for lifelong learning, offering events like "Medicare 101" that help residents make informed decisions on important life matters. By hosting these types of community education programs, SJCPL plays a pivotal role in equipping local seniors and families with the knowledge they need to thrive in today’s complex healthcare landscape.
If you or a loved one are unsure about navigating Medicare, don’t miss this opportunity to get the clarity and guidance you need.
